title: The Party of "NO" Weighs in on Budget Vote

content: quote: Originally posted by jack_flats: "http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20090429/ap_on_go_co/us_congress_budget_18" With a unanimous "NO" vote. When will they ever learn? lol When will the Dems learn? Well some have "17 Democrats, mostly from GOP-leaning districts, voted against it." "With the economy in recession and the bailout of the financial sector costing hundreds of billions of dollars, deficits would rocket to $1.7 trillion for the ongoing budget year, dipping to a still-astonishing $1.2 trillion in 2010. The national debt would rise from today's $11.2 trillion level to $17 trillion at the end of 2014. "The same Democrats who were outraged over a $455 billion deficit last year came to us this year with a budget that would lead to trillion dollar deficits," said Senate GOP Leader Mitch McConnell of Kentucky." "The Democratic plan assumes Congress will devote only $50 billion a year for operations in Iraq and Afghanistan for 2011 and beyond and pass an annual fix for the alternative minimum tax without adding to the deficit over 2013-14." There is no way $50 Billion is going to cover Iraq and Afghanistan. Idiotic thinking by the Dems. "Rep. Paul Ryan, R-Wis., said that Wednesday's news that the economy had shrunk by 6.1 percent in the first quarter highlighted the likelihood that the deficit numbers are even worse than predicted in the budget. "Put reality into the budget and the deficits and debt go much higher," Ryan said." "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford

content: That is why they voted against it. Just a larger deficit with no rational thinking. 50B isn't enought to cover Iraq and A-Stan. It will probably cost more than that just to get the equipment and everything out of Iraq. "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford

content: quote: http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20090429/ap_on_go_co/us_congress_budget_18 "Not a single Republican voted for the measureNo suprise; 17 Democrats, mostly from GOP-leaning districts, voted against itGuess you will call for then to be banned now, since they went against your god PBO.. " The national debt would rise from today's $11.2 trillion level to $17 trillion at the end of 2014" That might have somethig to do with them voting "no". But go ahead and support saddeling our children's children with OUR debt. ""The same Democrats who were outraged over a $455 billion deficit last year came to us this year with a budget that would lead to trillion dollar deficits," said Senate GOP Leader Mitch McConnell of Kentucky." i suppose your ok with this? I know, i know, why didnt they say anything when GW was in charged. Who knows, cause they were blind? You really defending this crap? "The budget also allows us ... an up-or-down vote on reforming health care — not as an option of first resort, but as a fallback if partisanship blocks progress," said House Majority Leader Steny Hoyer, D-Md." What Steny is really saying is "Ha ha! We won and we are gonna shove this downthe Americans throat and the lemmings will buy it" HA HA!! Thats what Steny is really saying. "Democrats say they and Obama inherited a record budget mess and deserve credit for cutting the deficit by two-thirds over the next five years"Really? How do you cut deficit and increase spending at the same time and still, somehow, find tax cuts and increase spending on domestic programs? The dems are asking for credit for something that hasnt and more than likely NOT happen in 5 years. Morons. "The Democratic plan assumes Congress will devote only $50 billion a year for operations in Iraq and Afghanistan for 2011 and beyond"But but but, PBO said that he was going to pull the troops out of Iraq in 16 or so months. He wouldnt lie to us would he? "Put reality into the budget and the deficits and debt go much higher," Ryan said."Can any of you that support this bloating of America honestly contradict what Rep ryan has said here, besides the usual fat tick dribble of "But Bush blah blah blah" and "The party of No is being partisian" Anyone? Jack, you may want to get your knees checked for being on them all the time at the altar of obama. GRAYMAN

content: Jack, You and I know that it ticks the Republicans off to no end that even with EVERY SINGLE GOP Representative in the House voting "No" (plus a few Democrats) that the Democrats can still pass the bill. It shows them how powerless and irrelevant they are, and the joke that the GOP has become.
